- **CycloneDX 1.5** (JSON) - 326 KB

Total components cataloged: 376 dependencies (including transitive)

## SBOM Verification

### Component Counts
```
CycloneDX: 376 components

Difference: 1 (metadata package vs. component counting)
```

### Cryptographic Dependencies Identified

#### Post-Quantum Cryptography (6 crates)
1. aws-lc-rs v1.15.4 - FIPS-validated ML-KEM
2. aws-lc-sys v0.37.0 - Native bindings
3. fips204 v0.4.6 - ML-DSA signatures
4. fips205 v0.4.1 - SLH-DSA signatures
5. fips203 v0.4.3 - ML-KEM (test vectors)
6. fn-dsa v0.3.0 - FN-DSA/Falcon signatures

#### Symmetric Cryptography (4 crates)
7. aes-gcm v0.10.3 - AES-GCM AEAD
8. aes v0.8.4 - AES block cipher
9. chacha20poly1305 v0.10.1 - ChaCha20-Poly1305 AEAD
10. chacha20 v0.9.1 - ChaCha20 stream cipher

#### Hash Functions (4 crates)
11. sha2 v0.10.9 - SHA-256/384/512
12. sha3 v0.10.8 - SHA-3/SHAKE
13. blake2 v0.10.6 - BLAKE2b/2s
14. digest v0.10.7 - Hash function traits

#### Key Derivation (2 crates)
15. hkdf v0.12.4 - HKDF (RFC 5869)
16. pbkdf2 v0.12.2 - PBKDF2 (RFC 8018)

#### Memory Safety (3 crates)
17. zeroize v1.8.2 - Secure memory zeroing
18. zeroize_derive v1.4.3 - Zeroize derive macro
19. subtle v2.6.1 - Constant-time operations

#### Random Number Generation (4 crates)
20. rand v0.8.5, v0.9.2 - RNG
21. rand_core v0.6.4, v0.9.5 - RNG traits
22. rand_chacha v0.3.1, v0.9.0 - ChaCha RNG
23. getrandom v0.2.17, v0.3.4 - OS entropy

#### Supporting Crypto (3 crates)
24. crypto-bigint v0.5.5 - Constant-time big integers
25. crypto-common v0.1.7 - Common crypto traits
26. fiat-crypto v0.2.9 - Formally verified arithmetic

**Total Cryptographic Dependencies:** 26 crates (34 versions including duplicates)

## License Compliance Summary

### License Distribution
All dependencies comply with the project's license policy (Apache-2.0, MIT, BSD, ISC only):

| License | Count | Examples |
|---------|-------|----------|
| MIT OR Apache-2.0 | ~300 | Most RustCrypto, FIPS crates |
| Apache-2.0 | ~30 | Internal arc-* crates |
| MIT | ~20 | Various utilities |
| BSD-3-Clause | ~5 | subtle, bindgen |
| ISC | ~3 | aws-lc-rs, aws-lc-sys |
| Unlicense | 1 | fn-dsa (public domain) |

## Supply Chain Security Analysis

### Source Verification
- **Allowed sources:** crates.io only
- **Verification:** All 376 dependencies from crates.io ‚úÖ
- **Git dependencies:** None ‚úÖ
- **Local paths:** Only internal workspace crates ‚úÖ

### Security Tooling Integration

#### 1. cargo-audit
```bash
cargo audit --deny warnings
```
- Checks dependencies against RustSec Advisory Database
- Fails CI on known vulnerabilities
- Run frequency: Every CI build

#### 2. cargo-deny
```bash
cargo deny check all
```
- License compliance validation
- Source verification
- Banned crate detection
- Run frequency: Every CI build

#### 3. SBOM Generation (This Phase)
```bash
cargo sbom --output-format cyclone_dx_json_1_5 > docs/sbom-cyclonedx.json
cargo sbom --output-format spdx_json_2_3 > docs/sbom-spdx.json
```
- Machine-readable inventory
- Vulnerability tracking enablement
- Compliance evidence
- Run frequency: Every release + quarterly

## Compliance Mapping

### FIPS Standards Coverage

| Standard | Algorithm | Dependency | Status |
|----------|-----------|------------|--------|
| FIPS 203 | ML-KEM | aws-lc-rs | ‚úÖ FIPS 140-3 validated |
| FIPS 204 | ML-DSA | fips204 | ‚è≥ Awaiting aws-lc-rs API |
| FIPS 205 | SLH-DSA | fips205 | ‚úÖ Audited |
| FIPS 206 | FN-DSA | fn-dsa | üîÑ Partial validation |
| FIPS 180-4 | SHA-2 | sha2, aws-lc-rs | ‚úÖ FIPS validated |
| FIPS 202 | SHA-3 | sha3 | ‚úÖ Standard compliant |
| SP 800-38D | AES-GCM | aes-gcm, aws-lc-rs | ‚úÖ FIPS validated |

### RFC Standards Coverage

| RFC | Algorithm | Dependency | Status |
|-----|-----------|------------|--------|
| RFC 8439 | ChaCha20-Poly1305 | chacha20poly1305 | ‚úÖ Compliant |
| RFC 5869 | HKDF | hkdf | ‚úÖ Compliant |
| RFC 7693 | BLAKE2 | blake2 | ‚úÖ Compliant |
| RFC 8018 | PBKDF2 | pbkdf2 | ‚úÖ Compliant |

---

## Risk Assessment

### High-Risk Dependencies (Monitoring Required)

#### 1. Pure Rust PQC Implementations (fips204, fips205, fn-dsa)
- **Risk Level:** Medium-High
- **Reason:** Not yet FIPS-validated (except aws-lc-rs)
- **Mitigation:**
  - Regular updates to latest versions
  - Tracking aws-lc-rs ML-DSA integration (aws/aws-lc-rs#773, our PR: aws/aws-lc-rs#1029 under review)
  - Independent security audits
  - CAVP test vector validation
- **Monitoring:** Monthly version checks, quarterly security reviews

#### 2. fn-dsa (Unlicense)
- **Risk Level:** Medium
- **Reason:** Public domain license, potential patent concerns
- **Mitigation:**
  - Legal review completed
  - NIST FIPS 206 compliance tracking
  - Patent search (ongoing)
- **Monitoring:** Quarterly legal review

### Medium-Risk Dependencies

#### 3. Version Fragmentation (rand: 0.8.5 and 0.9.2)
- **Risk Level:** Low-Medium
- **Reason:** Multiple versions increase attack surface
- **Mitigation:**
  - Consolidation planned for v0.2.0 (2026 Q1)
  - Both versions from same maintainer
  - No known conflicts
- **Monitoring:** Track unification progress

#### 4. Transitive Dependencies (376 total)
- **Risk Level:** Low-Medium
- **Reason:** Large dependency tree complexity
- **Mitigation:**
  - cargo-audit daily scanning
  - cargo-deny enforcement
  - SBOM tracking
  - Quarterly dependency review
- **Monitoring:** Continuous (CI/CD)

### Low-Risk Dependencies

All RustCrypto dependencies (sha2, blake2, aes-gcm, chacha20poly1305, etc.):
- Well-audited
- Widely used
- Active maintenance
- Strong security track record

---

## SBOM Consumption & Integration

### For Security Teams

**CycloneDX SBOM** is recommended for:
- Vulnerability scanning tools (Trivy, Grype, Syft)
- Software composition analysis (SCA)
- Dependency-Track integration
- CI/CD security gates

**Usage Example:**
```bash
# Scan SBOM for vulnerabilities
grype sbom:./docs/sbom-cyclonedx.json

# Import to Dependency-Track
curl -X PUT "https://dependency-track.example.com/api/v1/bom" \
  -H "X-Api-Key: $API_KEY" \
  -F "project=$PROJECT_UUID" \
  -F "bom=@docs/sbom-cyclonedx.json"
```

### For Compliance Teams

**SPDX SBOM** is recommended for:
- License compliance verification
- Legal review processes
- Government procurement (NTIA SBOM requirements)
- ISO/IEC 5962:2021 compliance

**Usage Example:**
```bash
# Validate SPDX format
spdx-tools validate docs/sbom-spdx.json

# Generate license report
spdx-tools license-report docs/sbom-spdx.json
```

### For Procurement Teams

Both SBOMs provide:
- Complete component inventory
- License information
- Supplier identification
- Version tracking
- Vulnerability disclosure readiness

---

## Maintenance Schedule

### SBOM Regeneration Frequency

| Event | Trigger | Tools |
|-------|---------|-------|
| **Release** | Every version bump | cargo-sbom (both formats) |
| **Quarterly** | Calendar schedule | cargo-sbom + manual review |
| **Dependency Update** | Major dependency changes | cargo-sbom (verification) |
| **Security Incident** | CVE discovered | Immediate regeneration |

### Review Schedule

| Activity | Frequency | Owner |
|----------|-----------|-------|
| Dependency version updates | Monthly | Engineering |
| Security audit review | Quarterly | Security team |
| License compliance review | Quarterly | Legal/compliance |
| SBOM format updates | Yearly | DevOps |
